ratings.comment: I will say that if you plan on having Professor Westerland, be prepared to do a lot of studying outside of class because he maybe does 1 example on each topic. He writes on a whiteboard and has very messy handwriting. I have been skipping class, using Organic Chemistry Teacher videos instead, and getting better scores on tests.

most unorganized math teacher I have ever met. messy writing. often unclear what he is talking about, an indicator of inadequate preparation for the class. makes either minor or essential mistakes at least once in every class. Exam problems always too many - almost no one could finish. Used textbook to teach myself a lot.
Excellent professor.  Keeps your attention.  Very clear and orderly lectures.
Professor Westerland is hot! I had to take a make up exam in his office and it was the best moment of my life!

Westercraig's lectures are very entertaining. He likes to throw chalk. However, there is somewhat of a gap between what is taught in lecture and what we are expected to know. The homework can be difficult, but not impossible. Use the TAs.
Very funny, fairly good lectures, though he gets confused at times.

class is HARD if you've never had calc before. I had to read the sections in the book for every assignment and still didn't do wonderfully on the quizzes and tests. Requires a lot of study time, especially if you're new at this.

After having Ram as a substitute (the day before our exam) I realized exactly how hard it is for Craig to make ideas clear. He seems to spend lots of time on the basics, then highlight only parts of the more difficult concepts. Had I not had an excellent TA, I wouldn't have received anything higher than a C.

Kind of awkward and nerdy, but cute and fun. A little scatterbrained, but doesn't negatively affect ability to teach and explain problems. A decent professor overall. Thoroughly explains everything and doesn't make us do stupid proofs. However, a good T.A. is probably needed to get an A, the exams can be a little tricky.
one of my favorite profs this year.  he teaches well and is interesting to listen to.  also, he is hot in that nerdy kind of way, but still very fun to look at.

Craig is a lot of fun to listen to during lecture. He is very hyper and funny. He seems a bit disorganized sometimes, but that can be attributed to his young age. Take him for Math 221 for easy tests, fair assignments, and interesting lectures.

Prof Westerland was a fairly decent teacher. He knows the information and teaches the lectures well. He messes up sometimes, but who doesn't? The quizzes were very difficult but then tests weren't as bad. The tests even used practice examples in the back of the chapters. I took the class in highschool so it wasn't too bad!

You know its gonna be hard, its not like on the easy class list, ya know??  he is kinda funny in a nerdy kinda way.  The exams are not bad, quizzes hard because the TAs make them up not the prof.  sometomes gets flustered on questions asked in class. do calc 221 small group tutoring in Van Vleck, very helpful. eye candy when daydreaming in class

He's good if you have taken calc before and he is really nice and quite helpful. WATCH OUT for his impossibe quizes and as for tests...they're okay with a couples impossible thrown in. I'd recommend this professor considering our options.

Unless you'd enjoy trying to teach yourself calc, take it from someone else.  He is disorganized, unable to make it through a whole problem without screwing it up, and the tests are hard.  I took high school calc, put myself in the tutorial program,and never missed class.  I still got a D.  The class was an absolute frustration.

Just gotta say, i went to lecture about 6 times throughout the semester but when i was there he was OK...goes VERY slowly over BASIC concepts and sometimes goes QUICKLY over DIFFICULT concepts. besides that, he alright

you know, everyone who reads this should keep in mind that the people posting comments didn't even know their professor's name.  It's CRAIG Westerland.   Perhaps showing up to class every once in a while might help.

I wouldn't advise taking calc with him unless you've taken it before.  The tests seemed to draw on assumed previous knowledge and same with some of the tests.  Of course he is fairly new at this, but I'd be careful if you haven't already taken calc before!
Didn't spend much time on the class and still ended up doing fairly well.  easy if you have taken calc before.
exams are pretty easy if you understand big concepts. If you spend a lots of time on homeworks and reading textbook, you will get an A

He is a pretty nerdy laid back young prof; inexperienced, but tries hard. Sometimes he loses track of himself in lecture. Has a very unique sense of humor, tries to get class to laugh most days. Quizzes hard, exams straightforward. If you know calc, easiest A ever. Recommend him, but be wary of your TA-if you are stuck w/ an incompetent one, getout

was new this smester, or at lest fairly new, so give him a break. He's relatively inexperienced in teaching, but he's actually pretty much average. And he always stops lecture and asks for questions, but nobody ever has any, which is a sign that he's getting the ideas across pretty well, right? right. anyways, he's better than my friends professors

He does not know what he's talking about. He teaches straight from the book and goes over two easy concepts per lecture and you get the feeling that it was a waste of your time. If you've already taken calc, it's simple though. Easy enough tests cause i feel like he may not be the most brilliant guy.

he was very easy if you already know what you are doing.  if you havent taken calculus before or did not understand it the first time you will probably be lost as many in my class were.  exams are not bad though.
He's quite a good professor.
No Comments
